title: Integrating multiple sources of ordinal information in portfolio optimization. (arXiv:2211.00420v2 [q-fin.PM] UPDATED)
abstract: Active portfolio management tries to incorporate any source of meaningful information into the asset selection process. In this contribution we consider qualitative views specified as total orders of the expected asset returns and discuss two different approaches for incorporating this input in a mean-variance portfolio optimization model. In the robust optimization approach we first compute a posterior expectation of asset returns for every given total order by an extension of the Black-Litterman (BL) framework. Then these expected asset returns are considered as possible input scenarios for robust optimization variants of the mean-variance portfolio model (max-min robustness, min regret robustness and soft robustness). In the order aggregation approach rules from social choice theory (Borda, Footrule, Copeland, Best-of-k and MC4) are used to aggregate the total order in a single ``consensus total order''. translated_title: 在投资组合优化中整合多个顺序信息源
translated_abstract: 主动投资组合管理试图将任何有意义的信息源整合到资产选择过程中。在本文中，我们考虑定性观点，将其规定为预期资产回报的总体排序，并讨论两种不同的方法来将此输入纳入均值方差投资组合优化模型中。在鲁棒优化方法中，我们首先通过扩展Black-Litterman（BL）框架计算每个给定总排序的资产预期回报的后验期望。然后，将这些预期资产回报作为鲁棒优化变体的可能输入场景，应用于均值方差投资组合模型（最大-最小鲁棒性、最小遗憾鲁棒性和软鲁棒性）。在顺序聚合方法中，使用社会选择理论中的规则（Borda、Footrule、Copeland、Best-of-k和MC4）将总排序聚合为单个“共识总排序”。然后，针对这个“共识总排序”计算预期资产回报。
tldr: 本文讨论了在投资组合优化中将定性观点的总体排序整合进均值方差模型的方法，包括鲁棒优化和顺序聚合两种方法。
en_tdlr: This paper discusses two approaches, robust optimization and order aggregation, for incorporating qualitative views specified as total orders into a mean-variance portfolio optimization model.
